sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to feed this <radical>grain</radical> to a <radical>flower</radical> wearing <radical>turkey</radical> on a <radical>stool</radical> so you start the <kanji>harvest</kanji>. Grains don't pick themselves, you have to harvest them.
meaningInfo: Picture this fat turkey with flowers on its head, sitting on a stool. It's gobbling for grains and you need to be the one who harvests them.
readingMnemonic: You're just starting to <kanji>harvest</kanji> the grains when an angry <reading>cock</reading> (<ja>かく</ja>) shows up! He's mad because these are his grains and you're about to harvest them and feed them to a turkey instead of him.
readingInfo: Imagine an angry cock chasing you around as you try to harvest grain. He keeps pecking you, ouch!
